title: Planning & Fulfillment Center Manager at ABB Process Control Platform
description:
At ABB, we help industries outrun - leaner and cleaner. Here, progress is an expectation - for you, your team, and the world. As a global market leader, we’ll give you what you need to make it happen. It won’t always be easy, growing takes grit. But at ABB, you’ll never run alone. Run what runs the world.


This Position reports to:


Head of P&F Automation Products **Your role and responsibilities**Are you ready to take the lead in shaping a high-performance supply chain at the heart of a global technology powerhouse? As Planning & Fulfillment Center Manager at ABB Process Control Platform, you’ll drive the strategic and operational direction of our supply planning and inventory processes, ensuring that our cutting-edge products reach customers with precision and speed.


This is your opportunity to lead transformation, optimize critical operations, and build a world-class team – all while making a real impact on customer satisfaction and business success in a fast-paced manufacturing environment.

**Your main Roles and Responsibilities are:****Operations Leadership**

* Direct daily operations and monitor performance against key operational targets.
* Address bottlenecks and operational challenges to maintain seamless EMS production and order delivery flows.

**Strategic Planning:**

* Develop and communicate strategic plans for supply chain and fulfillment that align with broader organizational goals.
* Conduct regular reviews of operational strategies to identify growth opportunities and efficiency improvements.

**Inventory Oversight:**

* Oversee cycle counting, audits, and reconciliation processes to maintain inventory accuracy.
* Implement proactive measures to prevent overstocking or stock shortages, balancing cost and COTD.

**Cross-Functional Collaboration:**

* Collaborate with procurement, logistics, and product development teams to optimize supply chain performance.
* Ensure smooth communication and alignment between fulfillment, production, and distribution teams.

**Technology & Process Implementation:**

* Lead system enhancement projects for planning, fulfillment, and warehouse management software.
* Implement new technologies and tools to streamline supply chain processes.

**Performance Monitoring:**

* Regularly track and report on operational metrics, providing insights and recommendations to senior management.
* Benchmark performance against industry standards to drive continuous improvement.

**Leadership and Team Development:**

* Recruit, train, and mentor direct reports and operational teams.
* Foster a culture of accountability, innovation, and collaboration across the P&F Center.

**Customer Focus:**

* Ensure customer requirements and expectations are met through effective planning and fulfillment.
* Implement strategies to improve customer delivery lead times and fulfillment accuracy.

**Risk and Compliance Management:**

* Establish risk mitigation strategies to safeguard operational processes.
* Ensure all operational activities are conducted in compliance with regulatory requirements and corporate policies.

**Continuous Improvement & Innovation:**

* Identify and drive continuous improvement projects that enhance supply chain agility and responsiveness.
* Encourage innovation within the team, promoting creative solutions to complex supply chain challenges.

  

**Qualifications for the role*** You are highly skilled in Lean Six Sigma, SAP ERP, and warehouse/supply planning technologies, and you enjoy working with operational excellence frameworks and digital supply chain systems in the electronics manufacturing and fulfillment market.
* Have established skills and over **10 years** of experience in operations, supply chain management, and production planning.
* (OPTIONAL: working as Planning and Fulfillment Center Manager with EMS operations, SAP platforms, and advanced inventory control technologies)
* Highly adept in SAP ERP, warehouse management systems (WMS), and performance monitoring tools.
* You are passionate about continuous improvement and are innovative around leadership development, collaboration, and strategic thinking.
* Extensive knowledge of and proven experience in **Industrial Engineering** or **Supply Chain Management or any other relevant studies**
* You are at ease communicating in **English** **and Swedish** across global and cross-functional teams.
* You hold current work authorization valid in the job location and comply with country-specific **VISA/work permit** requirements where applicable.

 **What's in it for you?**


We empower you to take initiative, challenge ideas, and lead with confidence. You’ll grow through meaningful work, continuous learning, and support that’s tailored to your goals. Every idea you share and every action you take contributes to something bigger.


Our benefits? Competitive, comprehensive, and crafted with you in mind.

**More about us**

  

Recruting manager: Farshad Afsharian. Union representatives - Sveriges Ingenjörer: Mikael Blomqvist, +46 768 06 00 11; Ledarna: Leif Öhrberg, +46 724 64 40 16; Unionen: Krista Andersson, +46 706 44 02 85.


We look forward to reading your application in PDF format. Last day to apply is August 17. Please note that the during the summer months (July-August), we will not review any applicants, and you will probably not hear from us during this time. We will continue the recruitment process in the beginning of August!


Please note that to be eligible for employment at ABB Sweden, you will need to pass our pre-employment screening steps. This includes a reference check, a drug test, and could also include an extended background check.


We kindly decline direct contact with staffing and recruitment agencies as well as sellers of additional job advertisements.


We value people from different backgrounds. Could this be your story? Apply today or visit www.abb.com to read more about us and learn about the impact of our solutions across the globe.

title: Test Engineer Automotive
description:
Sweden Mechatronics Gothenburg Hybrid
We are on the hunt for Test Engineers with automotive experience to work with industry-leading clients on the next generation of mobility solutions!

  


About The Member Company
We are a global high-tech consultancy company with a team of entrepreneurial engineers, scientists, and digital experts from around the world. Together we form a fast-growing and proud community. We offer consultancy services to high-profile clients globally in diverse service areas, such as:


* Technology & Engineering
* Energy & Renewables
* Life sciences & Pharma
* Digital & IT
**About this vacancy**
----------------------


You will be responsible for conducting test engineering activities across multiple abstraction layers, including component, system, and complete vehicle function levels. Your work will involve test analysis, planning, method definition, and execution, ensuring high-quality testing processes and results.


Key Responsibilities:

* Perform test execution in various environments, such as HIL, SIL, VIL, and real-world vehicle testing.
* Take responsibility for fault tracing, administrative traceability, and coverage analysis.
* Collaborate across different test infrastructures and support integration and technical alignment.
* Work with test assets, including Boxcar, CANalyzer, CANoe, INCA, DSA, CarConfig, and CarCom.
* Ensure the readiness and quality of test processes and support agile working methodologies.


**What we expect from you**
---------------------------


An Employneur that is a collaborative team player who believes in the power of positive influence. Embracing change, you continually seek innovative and improved approaches to tasks. Experience within any below is desirable:

* 2+ years of experience in test engineering within the automotive industry.
* Experience in component, domain, and complete vehicle testing.
* Proficiency with test tools such as CANalyzer, CANoe, INCA, DSA.
* Strong skills in fault tracing and troubleshooting.
* Fluent in Swedish and English.


Meritorious Qualifications:

* Experience in embedded software development, including proficiency in C, Python, MATLAB, TargetLink, or Ascet.
* A hands-on mindset—you're not afraid to get involved in practical testing and troubleshooting.
* A genuine passion for the automotive industry and a strong drive to stay at the forefront of its technological advancements.


**What you can expect from us**
-------------------------------


In the role as an Employeneur, you will have the opportunity to both develop your technical skills and drive your own growth and business. We place great emphasis on your personal commitment and your willingness to advance your development. To support you with this, you will have the chance to influence the type of projects you take and the professional development you want to invest in. In other words, you are in control of your career.

  

Since TMC is an international company, we can offer projects in various locations across different countries where we and our clients operate. Currently, we are represented in Sweden, the Netherlands, Belgium, France, Luxembourg, Spain, Portugal, Italy, Hungary, the U.A.E., the USA, and Canada. The world is your workplace!


#LI-LM4


The 5 basic principles of **employeneurship**
A long-term working relationship
Enjoy the security of a long-term contract and a stable source of income while getting the opportunity to work at diverse projects.


Individual profit sharing
Full transparency. That’s it. For each of your projects, you know your hourly rate, your costs, and your individual performance-based profit sharing, all in order to stimulate your inner entrepreneur.


Business cells
Our employeneurs are grouped in business cells based on their technical expertise. They are small, focused and function as high-grade knowledge networks. And as buzzing communities of close colleagues.


YOUniversity
Every employeneur drives their own career. Together, we make a plan for personal and professional growth. Receive personal coaching and an extensive training budget to keep developing yourself and deliver outperformance at our clients.

  

The Entrepreneurial Lab
Work on your technical dreams in our lab. Collaborate with others in multidisciplinary teams to unlock out-of-the-box thinking and innovative ideas as well as entrepreneurial skills.
company_description: At TMC we believe it's people who drive technology. Our Employeneurship model creates the best conditions for technical talents to do so.

title: Simulation Engineer Thermal
description:
HAPS is Synopsys' industry leading FPGA-based prototyping system, providing state of the art hardware and cutting-edge software to deliver the best-in-class integrated prototyping solution. See more details about HAPS at:
  
  

https://www.synopsys.com/verification/prototyping.html
  
  

The Synopsys Lund team works with new product development and supporting of the HAPS hardware platforms. As a member of this great team you will be given the opportunity to be a part of the entire design process, from product specification to test and validation.
  
We are looking for a talented individual for a simulation engineering role focused on thermals within the R&D team to design, analyze and optimize thermal management solutions for electronics components and systems. The role requires deep knowledge of thermal behavior in PCBs, devices, electronic packaging, with an emphasis on system-level behavior.
  
  

**Key responsibilities will include but not limited to:****Pre-design phase:**  

Perform thermal analysis of PCB design, collaborate with hardware engineers to optimize layout, review design work, and provide design guidelines
  
Design and optimize thermal solutions for electronic systems, including heatsinks, fans, vapor chambers, etc
  
Air Flow analysis
  
Conduct studies for next-generation cooling strategies
  
  

**Post design phase:**  

Verification of results
  
Develop thermal testing protocols
  
Implement measurements and analyze results
  
Thermal test design in climate chamber
  
Apply root-cause investigations of thermal failures
  
  

Experience in at least 3 of the above areas is a requirement.
  
  

**Typical candidate background:**  

Minimum BS with 8+ years/MS with 5+ years in thermal analysis or similar other relevant fields
  
Proficiency in thermal modeling and simulation software, experience with Ansys IcePak and Fluent.
  
Experience in 3D CAD tools , e.g. SolidWorks, Creo, etc.
  
Relevant and documented experience of above areas
  
Good problem solving and debugging skills
  
Excellent communication in written and spoken English
  
Strong interest and desire to develop and learn new things within electronics thermal analysis
  
  

**Other desirable attributes:**  

Experience of hardware design with FPGAs and/or use of FPGAs in other applications
  
Programming or scripting experience
  
Kindness, value team-spirit, help others, learn from others, drive progress
  
  

**Benefits from Synopsys:**  

Competitive base salary, may be eligible for an annual bonus, equity, and other discretionary bonuses
  
comprehensive health, wellness, and financial benefits as part of a of a competitive total rewards package
  
  

Learning and development budget for conferences and certifications

title: Completions Specialist / Quality Inspector
description:
**Location:**

Ludvika, Dalarna County, Sweden
**Job ID:**

R0099466
**Date Posted:**

2025-07-21
**Company Name:**

HITACHI ENERGY SWEDEN AB
**Profession (Job Category):**

Quality Management
**Job Schedule:**

Full time
**Remote:**

No
**Job Description:**

**The Opportunity**

HVDC (High Voltage Direct Current) is a product group in Hitachi, which develops, manufactures and sells DC transmission systems on a global market. HVDC technology is used to transmit electricity over long distances and for power transmission via submarine cables. It is also used to connect power systems.


We are now hiring a Completion Specialist to HVDC Sweden, a business line within Hitachi. As Completions Specialist you have a key role in the project by being responsible to perform inspections at Suppliers to ensure the equipment is manufactured according to the requirements. Work tasks are split between operational site visits to suppliers, performing inspections, and traveling. Strategic tasks as part of the department and different project teams for you to give input, report on findings, and work with other stakeholders both internal and external in preparation of and feedback about inspections.


We are interested to learn more about you and what you can contribute with so don’t hesitate to apply even though you don’t meet all requirements. A team with great cooperation and with diverse backgrounds is waiting for you to join!


**How you’ll make an impact**

* Understand the contract, specifications, budget, scope and other relevant project documentation related to the different types of equipment in the scope of the HVDC stations.
* Participate and be a decisive team player in the coordination meetings where inspections are distributed within the Completion Specialists.
* Perform inspections in line with the time schedule and the different contractual milestones, producing the inspection reports according to the project requirements.
* You care about delivering quality to the Customer and are not afraid to highlight the Customer's needs to the supplier to provide the best solution to the Customer.
* Identify, estimate and report cost savings or cost avoidance based on outcome of the inspections.
* Engage and support the stakeholders in the usage of the Project Completion System (PCS) database for tracking supplier inspections and punch items.
* Ensure all relevant documentation and punch items are correctly registered in the PCS including those identified during the Factory Acceptance Tests.
* Supervise the Suppliers in the completion of the Inspection and Test Records and punch items on a regular basis based on the scope.
* Raise deviations when deemed relevant based on punches.
* Takes part in completions meetings with customer, supplier, and Hitachi personnel and provide leadership on the actions assigned.

**Your background**

* Technical / Engineering / Quality management education or equivalent professional experience
* HVDC station equipment scope understanding a bonus
* Minimum 3+ years’ experience in a similar role.
* Knowledge and experience of working with a PCS such as PIMS and ProCoSys, or alternatively another similar inspection management software e.g., BIM 360 Field, Aconex Field, etc.
* Proficient oral and written communication skills including technical documentation and reporting
* Sensitive to Customer and project team needs and can develop a sustainable relationship to all involved stakeholders through clear communication, influencing and coordination
* English fluency (written + spoken)
* Availability to travel

**What we offer**

* Collective agreement
* Flexible working time
* Health care and wellness allowance
* Fantastic career possibilities within Hitachi Energy both within Sweden and globally
* Mentor to support you throughout onboard phase
* Various trainings and education supporting employee development
* Diversified company with over 70+ nationalities working in Sweden
* Supplementary compensation for parental leave
* Employee Benefit Portal with thousands of discounts and perks

**More about us**

Are you ready for a new exciting challenge? Does the above description sound like you? Welcome to apply! Applications will be reviewed on an ongoing basis, so don’t delay – apply today!


Recruiting Manager Daniel Martinez, daniel.martinez@hitachienergy.com will be happy to answer your questions regarding this position. Union representatives - Sveriges Ingenjörer: Mikael Hjort, +46 107-38 29 86; Unionen: Fredrik Holmgren, +46 107-38 21 85; Ledarna: Frank Hollstedt, +46 107-38 70 43. title: Executive assistant
description:
**Description**


**Opportunity**


We are looking for an Executive Assistant to support the Country Lead for our Business Unit Grid Automation in Sweden and part of our Network Control team. You will become the right hand of the managers and provide executive support to maintain a high level of leadership – a central and important part of our exciting units within Grid Automation.


You will play a central and highly valued role, facilitating communication between senior management and employees, coordinating with both internal and external stakeholders on a variety of projects and tasks. You will plan and orchestrate workflows to ensure priorities are met, organizational goals are achieved, and best practices are consistently followed.


We offer you an exciting and dynamic role with close collaboration with customers, partners, other departments and teams at Hitachi Energy both locally and globally.

**How you´ll make an impact**

* Manage professional and personal service support and scheduling, including agendas, mail, email, calls, travel arrangements, client management, and other company logistics.
* Coordinate scheduling and extensive calendar management, as well as the management of content and flow of information to senior executives.
* Arrange internal and external events, including travel arrangements, itineraries, accommodation, conferences, and visiting speakers.
* Organize team communications and plan events, both internally and offsite.
* Provide administrative and management support, such as meeting minutes, preparation of presentations, spreadsheet creation, and maintenance of administration systems.
* Administer and coordinate the signing of various documents while maintaining professionalism and confidentiality.
* Research, compile, verify, and analyze information and prepare special reports, presentations, organization charts, process maps, correspondence, etc.

**Your background**

* Experience in administrative role reporting directly to upper management.
* Flexible and service-minded team player willing to adapt to changes and enjoys a challenge.
* Strong time-management skills and the ability to organize, prioritize and coordinate multiple projects at once.
* Great written and verbal communication skills in Swedish and English is required.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office and other office productivity tools, with aptitude to learn new software and systems.
* It is a merit to have knowledge about and experience of working in our business systems, for example Workday, SAP HR, Easy Procurement, Fieldglass, MyIS, Basware, Teams events, Visio.
* Experience developing internal processes and filing systems is also a plus.

**What we offer**

* Collective agreement
* Flexible working time
* Health care and wellness allowance
* Fantastic career possibilities within Hitachi Energy both within Sweden and globally
* Mentor to support you throughout onboard phase
* Various trainings and education supporting employee development
* Diversified company with over 70+ nationalities working in Sweden
* Supplementary compensation for parental leave
* Employee Benefit Portal with thousands of discounts and perks

**More about us**

title: Workstream PMO - Sales & Commercial Operations
description:
At ABB, we help industries outrun - leaner and cleaner. Here, progress is an expectation - for you, your team, and the world. As a global market leader, we’ll give you what you need to make it happen. It won’t always be easy, growing takes grit. But at ABB, you’ll never run alone. Run what runs the world.


This Position reports to:


Commercial & Pricing Excellence Manager **Your role and responsibilities**


In ABB Robotics we are now looking for a **Project Manager** to join our **Sales & Commercial Operations team** to lead the **Project Management Office (PMO) for our functional Workstream** as part of the spin-off of the ABB Robotics division.


In this role, you will play a key part in planning, coordinating, and tracking the key activities across our function. You will work closely with cross-functional teams and senior stakeholders to ensure structured program governance, on-time delivery, and alignment with our commercial goals. Your ability to manage timelines, support workstream leads, and communicate clearly across different levels of the organization will be critical for success.


If you have a background in project or program management, strong coordination skills, and a passion for driving progress in a structured way, we’d love to hear from you.

**Work model:** Fixed term, 12 months

**Job location:** Flexible

  

Join us in supporting the transformation of our global sales & commercial operations!

**Key Responsibilities**


Program Coordination and Planning:

* Support the planning and execution of strategic initiatives across Sales & Commercial Operations.
* Manage timelines, milestones, dependencies, and deliverables for key projects within the PMO scope.
* Maintain and regularly update program documentation, reports, and status dashboards.


Governance and Reporting:

* Set up and maintain governance structures, steering committee routines, and project review cycles.
* Prepare presentations, status updates, and communication materials for leadership meetings.


Stakeholder and Team Collaboration:

* Act as a coordination point between project owners, business leaders, and technical teams.
* Ensure all stakeholders are informed, aligned, and supported throughout the project lifecycle.


Risk and Issue Tracking:

* Identify and document risks, issues, and action items.
* Follow up with responsible owners and ensure timely resolution or escalation where needed.


Tools and Best Practices:

* Promote the use of consistent PMO methodologies, tools, and templates.
* Contribute to continuous improvement of project tracking and reporting processes.

**Your Background**


Education and Professional Experience:

* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Business Administration, Engineering, or a related field.
* Project management certifications (e.g., PMP, Prince2, Agile) are a plus.
* Experience in project or program management, ideally in a global or cross-functional business environment.
* Strong organizational and time management skills.
* Familiarity with project planning and tracking tools (e.g., MS Project, Smartsheet, PowerPoint, Excel).


Skills:

* Excellent communication and coordination skills.
* Attention to detail and structured approach to managing tasks and timelines.
* Strong team player with a collaborative mindset.
* Ability to work independently and drive progress across multiple initiatives.
* Fluent in English, written and spoken.

**More about us**

ABB Robotics is a leading supplier of industrial robots and robot software, equipment, and complete application solutions. We are a trusted partner who continues to redefine robotics automation, focusing on collaborative solutions that allow humans to work safely alongside robots without the need for barriers.

description:
At ABB, we help industries outrun - leaner and cleaner. Here, progress is an expectation - for you, your team, and the world. This Position reports to:


Quality Manager **Your Role and Responsibilities**


Do you want to shape the future of robotics by ensuring the highest standards of quality and performance from our global suppliers?


As a Supplier Quality Engineer (SQE) at ABB Robotics, you will be responsible for managing and developing supplier quality for mass production materials within our Robotics & Discrete Automation Business Area. You will be part of a highly skilled team of approximately 8 colleagues, working closely with production, purchasing, and R&D to improve overall quality and cost efficiency. This role offers variety and is a great opportunity to enhance your career.


The role is based in Västerås.


You will be responsible for:

* Providing feedback to suppliers on production or customer detected issues and ask for corrective actions.
* You will ensure root cause analysis of supplier nonconformance, follow up and verify corrective actions.
* Reviewing 8D reports from suppliers is part of your daily work. We want you to drive the approval process for supplier parts in the SAP system and issue certificates to suppliers upon sample approval. Sometimes you lead improvement projects with suppliers based on quality or cost improvements.
* You support supplier quality related questions and work as a project team member in production and Supply Chain Management projects.
* You will participate in supplier evaluations and drive corrective action plans for PPM reduction. Perform annual audits on selected suppliers and manage the supplier’s Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) is also an issue that comes to you on a regular year basis.

**Qualifications for the role**

* Bachelor’s degree or minimum 2 years’ experience in Supplier Quality Engineering or a similar field.
* Familiarity with Electronics and Printed Circuit Board Assembly (PCBA).
* Knowledge of process audits and ISO 9001 and experience with PPAP, FMEA, and control plans.
* Proficiency in SAP.
* Experience with RCA (Root Cause Analysis), 8D, DMAIC (Define, Measure, Analyze, Implement, Control), or similar methodologies.
* Strong teamwork, social competency and communication skills with fluency in Swedish and English.

**What’s in it for you?**


We empower you to take initiative, challenge ideas, and lead with confidence. You’ll grow through meaningful work, continuous learning, and support that’s tailored to your goals. Every idea you share and every action you take contributes to something bigger.

title: R&D Associate Engineer - AI
description:
At ABB, we help industries outrun - leaner and cleaner. Here, progress is an expectation - for you, your team, and the world. As a global market leader, we’ll give you what you need to make it happen. It won’t always be easy, growing takes grit. But at ABB, you’ll never run alone. Run what runs the world.


This Position reports to:


R&D Team Lead **Your role and responsibilities**


In the Robotics team, we focus on robot concepts and design, autonomous and intelligent robots, as well as robotic applications in both industrial and service segments. Our research activities are typically structured as technology pre-studies and technology development projects. We work closely with ABB’s robotics business to ensure that our research delivers unique value to ABB’s future offerings. At the same time, we maintain strong collaborations with academia to bridge the gap between academic research and industrial application.


One of the key milestones in our team’s history is the creation and development of the dual-arm YuMi robot concept, as well as the mobile YuMi concept.

* You will be part of a team developing cutting-edge technologies in robotic automation powered by AI, focusing on easy robot programming, autonomous mobile robot control, and smart object grasping/manipulation using integrated robot control, vision, and AI technologies.
* The role requires solid knowledge and hands-on experience in implementing and developing vision systems for robotic applications. This includes integrating AI to enable next-generation autonomous robots capable of tasks such as dynamic object grasping in unstructured environments.
* You are expected to independently drive activities toward successful outcomes while maintaining a long-term vision. You will also document results through technical reports, invention disclosures, and scientific publications, and regularly present your work to peers, collaborators, and key stakeholders within and outside ABB.

**Qualifications for the role**

* A Master’s or PhD degree in Robotics, Control, Machine Vision, or Artificial Intelligence is required.
* Solid experience in developing vision and AI technologies for robotic applications is essential. Knowledge and hands-on experience in machine learning for real-world modeling and training is highly valued.
* Strong programming skills in C++ and Python are required, along with experience in ROS2. Familiarity with ABB's RobotStudio, RAPID programming, and modern software development practices such as Git, Agile methodologies, and continuous integration is considered an advantage.
* Demonstrated hands-on experience in applying and validating robotics technologies in real systems is crucial, including work with robot control, vision-guided robotics, and experimental development.
* The role requires the ability to work independently as well as in cross-functional teams within an international environment. Strong communication skills in English are essential.

 **What's in it for you?**


We want you to bring your full self to work—your ideas, your energy, your ambition. You’ll have the tools and freedom to grow your skills, shape your path, and take on challenges that matter. Here, your work creates impact you can see and feel, every day.

**More about us**

We work in close collaboration with other research centers, universities and our four business areas (Electrification, Process Automation, Motion and Robotics & Discrete Automation).

At ABB, we help industries outrun - leaner and cleaner. Here, progress is an expectation - for you, your team, and the world. PAEN Hub Sales Manager Northern Europe **Your role and responsibilities**


Take your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future. At ABB, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences.  

  

The role of the Sweden Local Division Marketing Manager for the Energy Industries division, is to develop and implement our holistic Marketing programme. Direct line reporting to the Hub Northern Europe Marketing Manager, and a dotted line to the Local Division Head of Sales in Sweden, you will ensure executional excellence for all Marketing activity in Energy Industries Sweden, in line with brand positioning, corporate identity/design guidelines and Hub / Global strategy. As part of this role, you will take ownership in creating marketing strategies and the annual marketing plan, that generate leads and gain market insights required to identify growth opportunities. You feed this information back to sales by taking initiative in working directly with the sales community.  

  

**Your responsibilities:**

* Work closely with the Hub Marketing & Communications resources to support your Local Division, utilizing their skillset to deliver your Local Division Marketing Plan. These include Events, Digital Marketing, Rich Content Creation and Branding functions.
* Closely collaborate with your peers in other Local Divisions in Northern Europe, to share best practice.
* Liaise with our Global Division functional resources, to support Local Division activity and leveraging Global Division initiatives for Local benefit. Adapt and localize global content or create content when needed to support campaigns globally.
* Work closely with sales to develop sales enablement tools and activities appropriate for the local markets and channels.
* Create social posts externally and share the news through appropriate social media outlets.
* Use marketing automation tools to plan, implement and execute campaigns.
* Support key management with external communications materials, including the briefing of materials, presentations, speeches, and through leadership articles.
* Manage contributions to key events such as trade exhibitions, develop and organize customer seminars (where not managed by the Hub functional role).
* Support global and regional media efforts by translating and localizing press releases for the local media.
* Identify and highlight key wins, successes, case studies, and technology applications in region. Create stories around these compelling topics to support and drive market leadership.
* Own the Local Division Marketing budget and ensure budget alignment with corporate and division communications at the local level.
* Use agreed metrics to show value creation and measure success.

* Bachelor’s degree with a minimum 3 years of industry experience in relevant Marketing positions, including industry experience.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills and an expert story teller.
* Excellent copywriting and editing skills, able to simplify complex technical contents into appealing marketing messages and contents.
* Fluent in Swedish and Excellent English skills.

title: Safety Engineer – ABB Marine & Ports
description:
At ABB, we help industries outrun - leaner and cleaner. Here, progress is an expectation - for you, your team, and the world. As a global market leader, we’ll give you what you need to make it happen. It won’t always be easy, growing takes grit. But at ABB, you’ll never run alone. Run what runs the world.


This Position reports to:


Engineering Manager **Your Role: Own the Challenge**


As a Safety Engineer within ABB Marine & Ports in Västerås, you will be part of a global leader in sustainable marine and port technology. Our systems improve safety, efficiency, and environmental performance in ports and on vessels. In this role, you will play a key part in ensuring our products and systems meet rigorous safety standards throughout their lifecycle—from design and development to installation and operation.


You will collaborate closely with mechanical, electrical, hydraulics, software, and systems engineering teams to integrate safety engineering principles into innovative, reliable solutions for our customers worldwide.

**Key Responsibilities**

* Lead safety assessments and risk analysis activities in accordance with ISO12100 and ISO13849.
* Ensure compliance with relevant directives and standards including the Machine Directive (2006/42/EC), Machine Regulation (2023/1230), and EN15011 for gantry cranes.
* Support the design and development of safety-related control systems and processes.
* Oversee safety validation and verification efforts within multidisciplinary project teams.
* Collaborate across engineering disciplines to ensure safety is integrated into all aspects of our systems.
* Contribute to the continuous improvement of safety processes, tools, and documentation.

**Qualifications**

* A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Mechanical, Electrical, Hydraulics, Software/Embedded, or Systems Engineering.
* Proven experience in industrial safety engineering, preferably within marine, ports, or heavy equipment sectors.
* Extensive knowledge and practical experience with safety standards and regulations such as:
	+ ISO12100 (Risk Management)
	+ ISO13849 (Control System Safety)
	+ Machine Directive (2006/42/EC) & Regulation (2023/1230)
	+ EN15011 (Gantry Cranes)
* Excellent communication skills with a collaborative mindset and the ability to work in cross-functional, multicultural teams.
* High level of integrity and a strong sense of responsibility for safety and compliance.

**Why ABB?**


We empower you to take the lead, share bold ideas, and shape real outcomes. You’ll grow through hands-on experience, mentorship, and learning that fits your goals. Here, your work doesn’t just matter, it moves things forward.


Guide the future. This is where innovation accelerates, industries are reimagined, and your impact powers the world ahead. Run What Runs the World.

**More About Us**


ABB Marine & Ports is pioneering sustainable solutions for marine vessels and port operations. With a focus on reducing emissions, improving safety, and increasing operational efficiency, we are shaping the future of maritime transportation. Located in Västerås, our team combines deep domain knowledge with the latest technology to develop world-class systems.


Recruiting Manager Mihai Nicolaescu. Union representatives: Sveriges Ingenjörer: Mikael Blomqvist, +46 768 06 00 11; Ledarna: Leif Öhrberg, +46 724 64 40 16; Unionen: Krista Andersson, +46 706 44 02 85.

title: Full-Stack Engineer II (.NET/React)
description:
As a
 **Full-Stack Engineer,** 
 you will develop solutions and applications for the services Cision provides.
   

  

 You will work with both frontend and backend development in an international team of 5 Software Engineers and 1 Test Engineer. You will work with scalable systems that have high availability and adhere to high security and high-quality standards. The day-to-day work will be conducted using agile methods with a focus on problem-solving and team collaboration.
   

  

**You’re a great fit if**
 … you are an independent and proactive individual who likes working in a friendly environment and is excited about joining a team transitioning to an AI-first approach to software development.
   

  

 We are looking for someone who is excellent at decision-making and problem-solving. In addition, you are prone to change and open to both giving and receiving feedback.
   

  

 Beyond that, we recognize that you may need further development in some areas, and we encourage you to apply even if your profile does not meet all the requirements for the role: we encourage and support growth and development for everyone.
   

  

**Your Qualifications**
* Experience with .NET (C#, WCF, microservices) and a basic knowledge of SQL
* Experience with JavaScript front-end frameworks such as React
* Fluent English in speech and writing
* Relevant degree in computer science or an equivalent combination of education and experience
* Proven hands-on experience in software development


**Meriting Experience**
* SQL Server, MySQL or Postgres
* Continuous delivery in Google Cloud
* The use of AI to create code


**What You’ll Do**
* Design and Implement Features: Build and maintain APIs and features. You’ll be directly involved in shaping solutions that are robust, scalable, and user-friendly.
* Collaborate Across Teams: Work closely within the team, as well as together with other teams, to deliver impactful solutions. Your input will help inform decisions and ensure alignment across teams.
* Own Your Code: Produce clean, efficient, and well-documented code while adhering to high standards. You’ll have the freedom to question existing practices, propose better solutions, and influence technical direction.
* Solve Problems Together: Participate in code reviews and discussions, where your voice and opinions matter. Help shape the team’s approach to problem-solving, performance, and maintainability.
* Be Product-Minded: Actively contribute to the evolution of the product experience by identifying improvements, engaging in story mapping sessions, refinements, discoveries, and collaborating with designers and product managers. You’ll help balance technical constraints with business needs and spot opportunities for impactful changes.
* Troubleshoot and Resolve Issues: Investigate, diagnose, and resolve issues reported by customer support, ensuring timely and effective resolutions.


**Please note that this position is only available to candidates who are currently residing in Sweden. Unfortunately, we are unable to consider applicants outside of the country.**
 Cision is the leading supplier of communication tools for investor and public relations. Our clients use Cision to handle every aspect of their communication - from identifying important media and opinion leaders to reaching out with their messages, monitoring traditional and social media and evaluating the impact of their communications. Cision is located in Europe, North America and Asia and has partners in more than 125 countries. Are you ready to take the next step in your career and work as a Software Engineer at the world-leading distribution company Cision?
